channel.title: Vastly Business
channel.description: Vastly Business brings you snackable, timely, and insightful clips from the best business & tech podcasts around. Vastly Business is powered by Vastly, a new video-first podcast discovery platform. Visit www.vastlypodcasts.com to learn more.

item.title: Lenny's Podcast: Failed Social Projects at Google and Facebook
item.description: Paul Adams, longtime chief product officer at Intercom, previously worked at Google and Facebook and explores many of the failed social projects he saw crash and burn at Facebook (Meta) and Google. They failed because they were born out of fear or the wrong motivations, he says.

media:content.media:title: Lenny's Podcast: Failed Social Projects at Google and Facebook
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Lenny's Podcast: Integrating AI Into Product Strategy
item.description: Paul Adams, longtime chief product officer at Intercom, a Customer Service software that provides a seamless customer experience across automation and human support, thinks AI is not a fad. He thinks it will reshape software and society, and all new product development should incorporate AI.

media:content.media:title: Lenny's Podcast: Integrating AI Into Product Strategy
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: How I Write: Marc Andreessen on the Importance of Writing
item.description: David Perell sits down with Marc Andreessen, Co-Founder of Andreessen Horowitz and Netscape. Marc discusses the power of writing in venture capital and the tech industry.

media:content.media:title: How I Write: Marc Andreessen on the Importance of Writing
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Logan Bartlett Show: Former Stripe COO on Managing vs. Leading
item.description: Redpoint’s Logan Bartlett speaks with Claire Hughes Johnson, known as one of the top operators in Silicon Valley. Claire shares management from her time as COO of Stripe and as an early senior executive at Google.

media:content.media:title: Logan Bartlett Show: Former Stripe COO on Managing vs. Leading
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Logan Bartlett Show: Hiring Advice From Former Stripe COO
item.description: Redpoint’s Logan Bartlett speaks with Claire Hughes Johnson, known as one of the top operators in Silicon Valley. Claire shares hiring lessons from her time as COO of Stripe and as an early senior executive at Google.

media:content.media:title: Logan Bartlett Show: Hiring Advice From Former Stripe COO
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Peel Podcast: How To Raise Your First Fund
item.description: Nichole Wischoff, founder of Wischoff Ventures, a Pre-Seed and Seed firm that invests up to $1 million in non sexy industries, had to hustle to raise her first fund. She shares her tips: network, and add value to your network.

media:content.media:title: Peel Podcast: How To Raise Your First Fund
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Peel Podcast: Get Your Firm's Name Out There!
item.description: Nichole Wischoff, founder of Wischoff Ventures, a Pre-Seed and Seed firm that invests up to $1 million in non sexy industries, notes that there are 3500 seed and pre-seed funds out there. To get founders attention, you need to stand out.

media:content.media:title: Peel Podcast: Get Your Firm's Name Out There!
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Lenny's Podcast: Duolingo Lessons From International Expansion
item.description: Gina Gotthilf, former Duolingo VP of marketing, shares insights from internationalizing Duolingo from a marketing perspective. Her main learning, perhaps counterintuitively, is to treat everyone the same.

media:content.media:title: Lenny's Podcast: Duolingo Lessons From International Expansion
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Lenny's Podcast: As a CEO, Do the Opposite
item.description: Brian Balfour, Reforge CEO, explains how to gain customer traction by defying trends and going against the grain.

media:content.media:title: Lenny's Podcast: As a CEO, Do the Opposite
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Lenny's Podcast: Product Market STORY Fit
item.description: Paul Adams, longtime chief product officer at Intercom, a Customer Service software that provides a seamless customer experience across automation and human support, thinks great products often fail just because their value is communicated in a convoluted way. Story is too important.

media:content.media:title: Lenny's Podcast: Product Market STORY Fit
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Logan Bartlett Show: Are Venture Capitalists Helpful?
item.description: Redpoint’s Logan Bartlett is joined by Liz Zalman and Jerry Neumann (co-authors of Founder VS Investor) to discuss venture capital and startup dynamics. Liz is a 2x founder who’s raised over $100 million, and Jerry has over 25 years of experience as a venture capitalist.

media:content.media:title: Logan Bartlett Show: Are Venture Capitalists Helpful?
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Logan Bartlett Show: Palmer Luckey's Career Advice
item.description: Palmer Luckey is the founder of Oculus (VR headset maker that sold to Facebook for $2.3B) and Anduril (an autonomous military technology company valued at $8.5B).

media:content.media:title: Logan Bartlett Show: Palmer Luckey's Career Advice
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Peel Podcast: What Are Contribution Margins?
item.description: Keith Rabois, an OpenDoor Co-founder and CEO of OpenStore, a portfolio of brands building its own shopping destination, gives a basic overview of the profitability term and its significance.

media:content.media:title: Peel Podcast: What Are Contribution Margins?
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Logan Bartlett Show: How the Utah Jazz Owner Applies Lessons From Tech to the NBA
item.description: Ryan Smith is the owner of the Utah Jazz, as well as the founder and former CEO of Qualtrics (recently acquired for $12B).

media:content.media:title: Logan Bartlett Show: How the Utah Jazz Owner Applies Lessons From Tech to the NBA
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: Lenny's Podcast: Know Your Customer, with Coda's CPO

media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship

item.title: How VCs Are Thinking About Investing in AI

media:content.media:title: How VCs Are Thinking About Investing in AI
media:content.media:keywords: Business, Tech, Technology, Podcast, Video, Consumer Tech, Entrepreneurship
